fields.summary: Export/Import Color Schema
Enable more results when searching on Mobile View

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51587].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When entering more than 255 characters into certain fields in Confluence, it triggers an error stating that the value could not be saved in Confluence due to it exceeding 255 characters in the database column.

h3. Suggested Solution

There should not be such a glaring error in the UI. Instead, it should either not save anything at all, or save the values up until 255 characters, and let the user know that they have entered more than 255 characters, and so it was not saved (or the value was truncated).
fields.summary: Better way to handle character limit exceeded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51576].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When editing a long page and selecting *Preview* the preview jumps to the top of the page, rather than staying focused on the section that was being actively viewed and edited.

We currently have the [edit a page, without losing your place|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.9+Release+Notes#Confluence5.9ReleaseNotes-Simplifyyour(work)life] functionality. The following can be performed wihtout losing the spot:
# Jumping into the editor from the page
# Saving the page from the editor

h3. Suggested Solution
# When selecting the *Preview* button to preview changes, the preview page should remain focused on the area that was in focus on the editor
fields.summary: Page previews should hold location focus from the editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51573].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The end of life health check reports as failed and fires a notification, however when viewing the page it has passed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup network such that the marketplace will not respond within 20s
# Start up Confluence
# Use as normal

h3. Expected Results

The end of life health check does not fail

h3. Actual Results

It does, and when viewing the page it reports as a pass

h3. Notes

The health check scheduler is setup with a timeout of 20s, however when viewing the page it has no timeout. This means background jobs can fail however the foreground will pass.
fields.summary: End of Life health check reports as a failure, when viewing the instance health page it shows as a pass
Log in as another user in Confluence Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51568].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA issues macro in table view is showing Epic Link when in display options only Epic Name is chosen.
h3. Environment
JIRA 7.2.4
Confluence 5.10.8 & 6.0.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic in JIRA
# In Confluence insert JIRA Issues Macro to the page
## Select the issue key of the Epic in a search
## In the display options
### select columns to display = Key, Summary, Epic Name, Epic Status, Issue Type => the table shows Epic Link instead of Epic Name
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-02 at 13.58.50.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-02 at 13.58.33.png|thumbnail! 
### select columns to display = Key, Summary, Epic Name, Epic Status => Same result for JIRA 7.2 and error for JIRA 6.4:
 !4-View without Issue Type.JPG|thumbnail!  
### select columns to display = Key, Summary, Epic Name, Epic Status, Epic Link => the table shows Epic Links instead of Epic Name and column Epic Links doesn't exist

h3.Workaround
No workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: JIRA issues Macro instead of Epic Name showing Epic Link column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51551].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Even after the fixes of [CONF-47752|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-47752], on some scenarios, questions content are not being saved to drafts. Due to this, the typed questions contents will then be lost.

h3. Suggested Solution
To add a warning to notify the user before the session timeout or notify them should there be any errors that occur during the creation of the drafts itself.
fields.summary: Session Timeout Warning Message on Confluence Questions Plugin
Enhance Space Permissions to Separate "Add" Page and "Edit" Page Permissions
Enable Clickable Hyperlinks in PDF Files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51544].
  {panel}

(copied from [Confluence service desk|[https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/14/CSP-194450])]

Attachment preview closes unexpectedly

Steps to reproduce:
1) Open a page attachment (e.g., PDF) in preview
2) click on the 'PDF' in the preview --> stays open
3) click on the grey background left or right or below the previewed document --> preview closes

This might be the intended behavior, but it is very annoying:
 * cycling through attachments using the arrows left and right - miss the arrow and the preview closes
 * scroll through a document preview - miss the scrollbar by a couple of pixels and the preview closes
 * working with comments, you may want to change focus between document and comment section - click a bit too far left or right and the preview closes.

Expected behavior: Attachment preview doesn't close unless I hit X in the upper right corner

SeverityLevel 4Affects Version/s5.8.5
fields.summary: Attachment preview: do not close when clicking next to document but only using X

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51543].
  {panel}

According to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34255 I would like to raise this request again with some more description: 

In our company we are creating pages with many attachments (pictures) for documentation. We have plenty of pages which has to be consolidated regarding content. So we have to merge two pages to one single page including all (attachments) pictures working in the content. The current strategy is to copy and paste the content from a source page to the target page - that works fine, but the pictures still refers to the origin. But after that you have to move EVERY SINGLE picture / file to the new destination page. This is no fun with e.g. hundred pictures... If you don't move the pictures you end up in "broken attachment" in the destination page (after deleting the source page). 

Merging two pages to a third one wouldn't be the best idea since the unique URL / link to the page would be lost. 

A "bulk move of attachments" would help already ! CONF-15025
fields.summary: merge two pages to one (incl. attachments)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51541].
  {panel}

I would like to suggest the following improvement to better handle tables in the editor:

An easy way to select and copy/move a table in the editor. this could for instance be a selector-button above the table, to select and then to copy/cut or drag the entire table with the mouse, just like the macros. 

 

Reason:

Often when editing a page, the user needs to move a table in or out of another macro. The current way to do this is highlight all text in the table and then hit CTRL+X. This can be very difficult, especially with larger tables.

By having a 'selector' it would be much easier to move/cut/copy of tables.
fields.summary: Tabel selector in page-editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51524].
  {panel}

Hi,

Following the changes to the Confluence sidebar last night, I can no longer see the Page Tree without clicking on the Home Page, clicking on Pages, clicking on a Page - then the Page Tree sidebar opens up (next to the new sidebar) - where previously I could configure it as part of the sidebar by default. I'm also finding when I go to another space, and then come back, I need to step through the additional clicks to get back to the Page Tree.

The changes have also introduced white space which is forcing additional page scrolling that now means what we could see on one page before, now we need to scroll down.

Support told me that the changes were intended to 'streamline the experience' but I'm not sure how the changes have achieved this when they introduced extra clicks and page scrolling.

Also, as my team is constantly using the tool all day, every day, the additional icons to track "my work" are not helpful as we typically look-up, create and edit many pages each day, therefore "recently worked on" and "recently visited" doesn't serve as a quick access tool. It also doesn't help my users who need to search the page tree or use search to find the pages in the first place.

It would be great if the changes could be reconsidered to accommodate the feedback from users who are using Confluence on a daily basis as their key work tool rather than assuming the pain points and then modifying the user's experience to something less effective.

Cheers,

Bonnie
fields.summary: Changes to Confluence sidebar / page tree don't streamline the user experience

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51521].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's only possible to notify users in a HipChat room if, in a given space, a: 
* Blog post is created
* Page is created
* Page is updated

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a notification when a page in the space is commented on. 
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Add option to notify HipChat room when a comment is added to a page or blog post
Autocorrect time if it doesn't have :00

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51494].
  {panel}

Just playing around with this, it's going to get quite confusing just seeing your name on a date and not knowing what that is for. The month and week views only so you the name for people calendars. 

My suggestion is to change the description on the lozenge to be <NAME>: <Description>  if there is a description. If there isn't it should just say <NAME>. 

For example, if I put Sherif Mansour, then desc: "Going to SF for Summit" the lozenge should say: "Sherif Mansour: Going to SF for Summit".

What we should do is put an ellipsis? for the number of characters - so it doesn't look ridiculous (30 characters?)
fields.summary: People calendar should show event description in month and week views
Allow import of ICS files that do not contain time zone data
Inform the user if they appear to have the old calendar plugin installed
Long calendar names in the calendar search results sometimes do not ellips
Search dialog scrollbar does not hit the footer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51436].
  {panel}

Problem: I've just embedded the calendar on the page, now what? 

Solution: 
When the user inserts a calendar for the _first_ time they get this dialog: 

!http://cl.ly/image/41081W2X1B1b/Image%202012.07.27%207:07:04%20PM.png!

Clicking out of the dialog should dismiss it
Clicking Got it, thanks! should dismiss it
Clicking on the macro property panel or the "save" button should dismiss it

This should only happen for the first time the user has created a calendar _in the editor_.
fields.summary: Guide the user as to what they can do next when they add a calendar from the editor
In the in-line dialog, limit the number of characters for the event description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

See the attached file.

In the normal Confluence QuickNav seach you see can see the related space when you hold the mouse on the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51416].
  {panel}

When a user loads team calendars for the first time they get this:

http://cl.ly/image/2I3V1I210O0V

With the assumption that most know start with their country rather than their timezone offset, we should change the display formatting of this dialog so its "Country/City (Timezone)"

Has two benefits:
1. Quick typing (So I can type Aus...) and quickly search the dialog
2. Improves scalability when I quickly look down the list looking for my timezone
fields.summary: Improve the readability and quick scanning of setting your default timezone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51414].
  {panel}

We introduced this message when the user has hit the JIRA issue limit:
http://cl.ly/image/3Y3z2J1n2B0L

I've had a lot of feedback internally that the error message is confusing. Some problems:

1. We don't tell the user what we've done - we only show 1,000 issues, but which 1,000?
Suggestion: 
* Remove the text "Error(s) occurred" change to 
{quote}
"Oops! We've found an some issues with your JIRA calendars: 
* Confluence JIRA release calendar is very large. We've limited the number of events to 1,000 for performance reasons. <LINK>Edit the JIRA calendar</LINK> to reduce the number of events returned."
{quote}
\\

2. It looks like a very strong error message, when in reality it isn't too bad of an error. 
Suggestion: 
* This should be a yellow AUI box, not a red one. 
* In addition, it should be dismissible - you should be able to acknowledge the notice and not see it come up again every time - an "x" up the top left?

Is there anything else we can do to improve this experience?
fields.summary: Improve the JIRA (1,000 issue) and event calendar (200 events) limit experience
Reduce the amount of events displayed on the dashboard events list if there are many events on the same day
Ensure workbox notifications get sent for initial install AND upgrade in OnDemand
Allow users/groups access to edit the name of calendars (and edit calendars), not just the creator.

Make Team Calendars display in a Confluence Page Gadget, for use on a JIRA Dashboard
Ability to subscribe to JIRA Calendars

Week view should have a default sensible time window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51402].
  {panel}

Following a recent support ticket with a customer, I have been asked to create this improvement request to ask for an improvement in the way Team Calendars import functionality works. The customer needs to import 88 ICS files from their old Calendar and then reassign the calendars to their respective owners.

The customer's workflow for each of the 88 ICS files will be as follows:

   * Communicate the process to the customer
   * Download all ICS files
   * Perform the migration
       ** switch to user x (using SU plugin)
       ** import ics
       ** go to the calendar page containing the calendar
       ** add the user calendar there, and make the color match the original one.
   * Get approval
       ** Present
       ** Process feedback

As such, they have requested that we consider ways of easing their pain in future, such as providing some form of automated import functionality and/or allow imported files to be assigned to different owners so that it isn't necessary to follow the above steps to migrate from their old calendar into Team Calendars.
fields.summary: Improve the Import Functionality for Team Calendars
Extract the timezone-dd-template and user-timezone-dd-template scripts into something that can be cached
Modify the add calendar dialog to include "Import" and "By URL"
Show week number in Team Calendar
Show total (summary) days
Make calendar names searchable within Confluence
Update the team calendar automatically when a new meeting is updated in Outlook Calendar.
Same width tabs in event calendars
Improve upcoming events view logic - filter by #of events, not by #of days
Add ability drag and drop Jira calendar events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51388].
  {panel}

*Team Calendars' behavior depends on the UI language*
When users with French UI create a new event calendar, for example, that calendar is sort into a section "Calendriers dévénements." But when users in German or in English create a event calendar, that calendar is plied under the section "Events Calendars." Team Calendars regards Calendriers dévénements and Events Calendars are different categories. I think this is a bit confusing as the same type of calendars are filed under different sections based on which UI langusge users use when they create a new calendar. 

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create an event calendar in English
# Change your language pack to French
# Create an event calendar in French

Outcome: A new heading is created for "Event Calendars" on the right

Expected Outcome: The event calendar you created in French should go under the same "event calendars" heading as the English one. The only thing that should change is the title of the "Events Calendars"
fields.summary: Calendar type names same for all languages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51387].
  {panel}

Would like to have Team Calendars be able to display issues in a JIRA calendar based on created date. Currently this is not selectable. 

I've gone and created a custom field in my JIRA project 'Created On' and made it required. 

I then can use jql (project = test AND created >= 2011-10-01 AND created <= 2012-10-31) and the custom field 'Created On' to get a calendar for my project showing how many issues were created for this project and when they were created. However, this does not allow me to create these calendars for historical data. 

I think it would be good if we can get Team Calendar to use the created field that is native to issues in JIRA to display from.

Screenie attached.
fields.summary: Ability to select "issue created date" for JIRA calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51386].
  {panel}

Feature request to track sprint start and end dates in Team Calendars. 
We could do this by adding the ability to show sprint start an end dates with the list of fields to show (e.g. "Show:
- Version Due Dates
- Issue Due dates
- Sprint Durations
... etc..")

Related GreenHopper feature request: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3254
fields.summary: GreenHopper Sprint integration
2 Way Sync of Google Calendar Events, Allowing Event Edits in TeamCal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51384].
  {panel}

When multiple team calendars are selected for display on a page, the calendar color is rendered by there isn't any identification of the calendar name or associated color.  The only place you can see the association of calendar color and calendar name is on the Team Calendars page where you manage all the calendars in the Confluence instance.

It would be useful and nice to be able to display a legend as part of the calendar view (month, week, list)
RED - CONFERENCE ROOM A
BLUE - CONFERENCE ROOM B
GREEN - CONFERENCE ROOM C
fields.summary: provide an option in the team calendars macro to display a color legend
Allow confluence-admin to update restrictions on a team-calendar
Reduce the amount of white space in the list view when there are only a few events
Read/write access from Outlook
Fix Team Calendars breadcrumb link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51370].
  {panel}

Team Calendars should show each event summary.

The suggestion is to show it in a tooltip when hovering over an event. So weather a team member is on leave/training/etc. 

This suggestion began as a [question on the answers forum|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/81496/showing-event-summary-on-team-calendar]

A hover would work even better if the event field was customisable as a dropdown selection (feature request [TEAMCAL-523|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-523])
fields.summary: Showing event summary in tooltip on team calendar event
Improve appearance of error icon for Team Calendars by making it match color of error dialog
Integrate with daily/weekly summary email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51365].
{panel}
As a user I would like the ability for an event/meeting to occur at regular monthly intervals such as:
 * The 1st Thursday of every x Month (where x = 1, 2, 3, ...); or
 * Every Monday, every x weeks (same as above)

This is important for events that occur on a regular basis that aren't every 4 weeks (resulting in some meetings occuring 2x in one month).

A great example of this functionality is MS Outlook. Its recurrence function is elegantly simple and very powerful. As it is, to create the calendar I want, I have to create them in outlook, export as iCal and then import into Team Calendars. It's nice to be able to do that, but this seems like a feature that should exist within the Team Calendars recurrence functionality.
fields.summary: Add Ability for an event to occur on the Xth day of each month, week, etc...
Support embedded JIRA calendars (of public projects) for the anonymous user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51358].
  {panel}

We completed our migration to Team Calendars last weekend.
It took nearly 15 hours of manual work to import that calendars, set permissions on them, and update the wiki markup on pages where the calendar was used.
Much of that time was spent waiting.
If you're importing a large number of calendars the performance of the "My Calendars" section gets slower for the following actions as the number of calendars listed increases:
# Importing an additional calendar
# Setting permissions on a calendar
# Removing a calendar from the list

As a Confluence administrator, you may wish to have a large number of calendars visible on your "My Calendars" page. However, the performance impact is huge.
From what I can tell the performance slow down is a combination of re-loading all calendar information for changes that affect only a single calendar, and the browser then parsing the returned calendar data, generating the DOM, and re-painting.
fields.summary: My Calendars page performance degrades linearly as calendars are added
Provide access to MS Exchange
When adding an event with a macro, order calendars alphabetically
Take advantage of UPM 2.0 licensing API
Allow option to use global logo for My Calendars page
Show loading indicator on dashboard and don't throw errors if users navigates away before calendar is loaded
Add a feature Event Details like used to have in Calendar plugin
For month view, change calendar legend so they appear sideways instead of under each other
Allow groups to be associated to Events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51344].
  {panel}

When events are currently loading in Team Calendars, there's a small spinner beside the add event button. On higher resolution and/or larger screens, this spinner is TINY and hardly noticeable.

It would be better if the entire calendar area was greyed out with a central, larger spinner to indicate that events are loading. When the events are loaded, the spinner disappears and the grey overlay is removed.

This comes from a place where we have users in Dublin with events on a server in California.
It can take longer that people are used to retrieve the events when there a big geo-gap.
fields.summary: When loading events it should be more obvious that something is happening
Allow the users to choose the number of weeks that the calendar will show
CalDAV support
Internationalization
Calendar owners should be able to remove members/subscriptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51336].
  {panel}

We noticed this in a few customer interviews, one customer went through the effort of adding a jquery hack of removing the icon from the upcoming events view.

Why? When they only have one event calendar, all the icons look the same, and it looks a bit recidivous.

Internal example: http://cl.ly/image/2z2g370w1S0C

Proposal:
* Add a new param to the macro which is "Show event icon" with the field tip "Applies for list view only", unchecked by default
fields.summary: Macro option to hide the event icon for upcoming events view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51333].
  {panel}

A customer had the following [question|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Team+Calendars+FAQ?focusedCommentId=288657309#comment-288657309] on CAC:

bq. Hey, is it necessary to have a login in order to insert someone's vacation into the calendar? for example we have three users, Peter, Max and Jane and only Peter and Jane have a login. Is it possible for Peter to insert Max'es vacation into the calendar so that this inserted vacation does not appear to Jane as Peter's vacation?

If you could add users to a people calendar via email, you'd be able to add someone to a people calendar without them being a user of the system.

It could also be a good way to spread Confluence to potential new users ;)

!https://img.skitch.com/20120526-jci56xhmr2s7995m9yebyi6uxk.png!

!https://img.skitch.com/20120526-1xg583986at5rpmrkb4jjge2r7.png!
fields.summary: Reference a person in the people/who field by email
Macro should link to my calendars screen with create dialog launched if no calendar found
Allow calendar macro to request Jira calendar without having to add calendar first to team calendars
Load dashboard calendar asynchronously
Hide Weekend or Hide Day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51323].
  {panel}

Although this is similar to TEAMCAL-269, this is more focused on the reporting use case. 

We've had requests for the ability to get calendar information for reporting purposes. This is a slightly different set of API requirements than the ability to create, edit and update calendar events.

This issue is to track the general requirements to:
* Get a listing (or sub-set) of calendars based on some query 
* Get some calendar metadata 
** Creator
** Last updated 
** # of events
** etc...
fields.summary: Provide an API to retrieve calendar details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51322].
  {panel}

When a macro is embedded on a page (month/week/list views) we should
* Show below the macro the calendar(s) that are displayed 
* Provide the ability for a user to "subscribe (and/or watch)" to each calendar embedded. We can use this opportunity to make the mycalendars.action view more discoverable.

For example, you might go to a page that has embedded the PM Travel Calendar. Below the month view it says "Calendars: PM Travel Calendar, PM Leave Calendar". Each of these could be links to the preview calendar action, making that section more discoverable. We could even put up a dialog that says "you can access this again from the Username > Calendars" menu or the dashboard link (insert screenshot here)
fields.summary: Make subscribing and watching a calendar from a macro view more discoverable
Year View
Use AUI jQuery UI instead of bundling it
